meta.title: Natomas Unified School District - Connecting students to their future!

meta.name: description
meta.content: Natomas Unified School District exists to produce self-confident, productive, responsible and ethical citizens by teaching academics, critical thinking, social skills, cultural competence, and an appreciation for learning in a safe and nurturing environment.

a.title: Important Message: Be ready, take care of each other, and here we go…

h2.a: Important Message: Be ready, take care of each other, and here we go…
Notice of Public Hearing: NUSD SELPA Local Plan, Annual Service Plan, and Annual Budget Plan for Special Education
Memorial Day – No School, Ed Center Closed

div.div: NUSD increased Career Technical Pathways to 10 with 736 students enrolled in the 2019-20 school year
NUSD outpaced the state in 11th grade ELA and Math growth over last 5 years
Students in class of 2020 earned more college credits by junior year than previous graduating classes
1 in 3 NUSD students are enrolled at International Baccalaureate (IB) schools
NUSD tripled number of students taking AP tests within the last 5 years
70% of our graduates met A-G requirements, courses required for CSU/UC admission
Hispanic/Latinx graduation rate is 95% compared to the state average of 81%
African American graduation rate is 97% compared to state average of 73%
NUSD's graduation rate is 96% compared to state average od 83%
